intro: Dichapetalum costaricense, commonly known as the Costa Rican dichapetalum, is a flowering plant native to the cloud forests of Costa Rica. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically pink or red in color. Its leaves are large, broad, and have a rough texture, while its stems are woody and often branched. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations in its humid, mountainous habitat.
